Welcome to the National Cancer Institute’s Office of Management Policy and Compliance (OMPC) Risk Management database. The purpose of the database is to support the NCI Risk Management Program and serves as a centralized repository for NCI’s risks. The NCI Risk Management Program operates with the purpose of:

  • Supporting the research mission and vision of NCI.
  • Improving strategic decision-making.
  • Identifying risks and proactively managing them.
  • Increasing organizational efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Promoting accountability and integrity of the organization's work.
  • Using a common approach to evaluate operational and management risks.

Access to this site is limited to NCI staff involved with the annual risk inventory assessment cycle. Additional information on the NCI Risk Management Program including last year’s risk inventory and database user cheat sheet can be found here: https://nciconnect.nci.nih.gov/OMPC/Pages/risk.aspx
